Csaba Hoch — <hh/387> <↑hh/384> (2009-07-07)

Attila Nagy Mysterious comment about underscore usage <hh/623> <↑hh/384> (2009-10-02) 
>     +    TODO: standardize underscore usage.
>
> What do you mean by this?

If you have a look at tha data attributes of GeneratorOptions, you see
this:

    indices
    write_toc
    shortsubject
    shorttags
    locallinks
    always_active
    ...

Most of them are composed from two words, but some are just written
together, some are separated by underscore. This is the situation I
wanted to warn about.
Csaba Hoch — <hh/628> <↑hh/623> (2009-10-03) 
You are right. Unfortunately the standard Python library itself is a
bit lax on this subject.

An even stranger example from Hk's code is htmlthreadfilename :)

The problem is that I don't know a good rule of thumb. E.g. I don't
think html_thread_file_name would be the best name for that method.
